Quickstrike:






Quickstrike lead the way through the front part of the cave. It was nearly 
pitch black at the end of it. He activated his infra red vision to make it 
easier to see. The farther it walked down, the more confusing it got. It 
looked like it went at a dead end.

He stopped and tilted his head, musing at what was behind his optics. Below 
him, he heard the slight trickle of water. He looked down and saw at least 
an inch of water touching his feet, enough to make the ridges on the bottom 
of his feet disappear. He thought there must be a water source within the 
cave.

Just as he was about to step ahead, he went down. It felt like the ground 
had collapsed--with the splash. The puddle of water that filled the hold 
area turned into a pool. Quickstrike twisted and turned, trying to find what 
way was up.

He righted himself and tried his luck. His head surfaced, coughing from 
surprise. After he got a breath, he felt something pull at him. There was a 
tug, then a violent yank. He was again pulled underwater. But this time he 
couldn't fight to get back up to the surface. Something had his leg, pulling 
him.
